<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 230, 292]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 301, 210, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 3 (Core)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[732, 277, 905, 293]]<|/det|>
0580/32  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[732, 302, 905, 317]]<|/det|>
February/March 2024  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[841, 326, 905, 341]]<|/det|>
2 hours  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 395, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 400, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: Geometrical instruments  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 230, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 280, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 760, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 806, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 562, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 480, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 359, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 480, 543]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 544, 333, 559]]<|/det|>
You may use tracing paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 467, 575]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 855, 606]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 606, 485, 621]]<|/det|>
For \(\pi\) , use either your calculator value or 3.142.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 651, 218, 666]]<|/det|>

[4] <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 411, 146, 428]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 411, 364, 428]]<|/det|> \(\mathcal{E} = \{\text{children in a school}\}\) <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 427, 384, 444]]<|/det|> \(F = \{\text{children who like fruit}\}\) <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 441, 435, 458]]<|/det|> \(V = \{\text{children who like vegetables}\}\) <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 467, 529, 484]]<|/det|> 24 children like vegetables but do not like fruit. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 483, 574, 500]]<|/det|> 8 children do not like fruit and do not like vegetables. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 498, 270, 515]]<|/det|> \(\mathrm{n}(F\cap V) = 9\) <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 515, 288, 533]]<|/det|> \(\mathrm{n}(F) = 3\times \mathrm{n}(V)\) <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[306, 541, 688, 696]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 714, 181, 732]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 714, 420, 732]]<|/det|> Complete the Venn diagram. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 714, 920, 732]]<|/det|> [3] <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 745, 181, 763]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 745, 359, 763]]<|/det|> Work out \(\mathrm{n}(F\cup V)\). <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[641, 777, 920, 794]]<|/det|> .......................................
